snippet: President Obama and his campaign are arguing that the Romney-Ryan approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs.
abstract: One of the biggest challenges facing the Republican ticket is countering the Democrats' longstanding advantage as the party more trusted to deal with Medicare; Pres Obama and his campaign have been making the case that Mitt Romney's approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs, and polls seem to suggest that the strategy is working.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and his campaign are arguing that the Romney-Ryan approach to Medicare would leave older Americans vulnerable to rising health care costs.

headline.seo: In Poll, Obama Opens Medicare Edge Over Romney
headline.main: Challenged on Medicare, G.O.P. Loses Ground
headline.print_headline: Challenged on Medicare, G.O.P. Loses Ground
